info.name: Edinger-Westphal nucleus
info.description: The nucleus of Edinger-Westphal is a parasympathic cranial nerve nucleus that is part of the oculomotor complex of nuclei. It is the origin of the preganglionic parasympathetic fibers that travel via the oculomotor nerve (CN III) to synapse in the ciliary ganglion. it constitutes the efferent limb of the direct and consensual pupillary light reflexes and of the near reflex.
